reviews.review_msg: She was a great help in office hours and was very good at explaining things clearly. Would recommend!

She was a great lecturer for the the most part, and was sure to go through examples. She also had fun demos every week that really helped to explain concepts. She also advocated for students in her section when we were behind the other sections so we could get homework extensions.
Stay Away

I like Simin as a person, however her teaching skills lack, horribly. Most of Physics 100 was done by self teaching myself. She loves to trick you on the multiple choice for the exams. I have taken her for Physics 100 and will not make the same mistake for Physics 101.

All iClicker are just trick questions that she expects we can figure out in 2 mins. Plus, everything new that she taught (and that's putting it mildly) made no sense, I had to completely self teach. Avoid if ur not good at physics, but if ur really good, you'll probably be fine, only with many more gray hairs at the end of the semester

Midterms were pretty chill. Hated how she made us do exams in groups, it was a waste of time and only benefitted the other ppl in my group. I disliked how she taught certain concepts, I was often confused on how she ended up with certain formulas and what the process was. I wish she did more in depth examples in class instead of just small ones
her practice final was a joke - nothing like the actual final. there is lots of homework and overall a hard course.

Somewhat nice and understanding prof but she expects you to know everything based on homework. Also do not rely on her practice exams, I found them to be way easier than what we were given on midterms and final.
Simin was a good professor and was very nice however, the course material was pretty difficult and sample exams did not correlate with the exams at all.
Sample exams have no correlation to the actual exams and her teaching is not great

I can definitely agree with all these other accurate 1.0 ratings that she is a terrible prof. Her exams are just NOT IT. I don't know what happened from the previous years, but she made it so much harder and just unfair this year. The best advice I can give you is to AVOID taking Simin's classes.
She is not the best teacher when it comes to teaching physics since she barely goes over anyslides and she then expects that you to do homework which tends to be harder then what she teaches.

HER EXAMS R HARD ASF, DONT RELY ON PRACTICE EXAMS. not similar at all. your best chance to do good is either being naturally good at physics or do textbook questions and a lot of practice. (Dont take this course)

Let's start with terrible professor. Her lectures are boring and full of her over explaining formulas instead of actual content. Doesn't review exam study sheet until a day before exam. Exam is NOTHING similar to the exam study sheet or anything that has been taught as she thinks and said in her own words it is "cheating" when its her job dont take
terrible prof... If you only rely on doing her practice exams to help you study for the exams, YOU'RE COOKED
She does not cover examples relative to exam and homework difficulty and is impossible to reach during office hours. have fun

Dr. Simin Najmi is a great prof, she goes through topics in depth and will cover previous assignments and bridge assignments in lectures to provide her students a better understanding and explaining how she got that answer. However, she does give off a lot of homework which can be a bit overwhelming if you have a heavy semester.

She is a very well spoken professor who not only knows the course content very well, but also how to explain it simply in lectures. The prelecture assignments took a lot of time, but were definitely worth it because of how they helped me understand material. The midterms also all had a portion done in groups, which was so helpful.

Dr Simin is great. Absolutely wonderful prof. Can occasionally overcomplicate material in my opinion but is overall very clear, direct and patient with the class. Includes demos which are helpful for understanding and engaging. Midterms have a group portion which I was very hesitant about at first but ended up liking a lot. 10/10
Despite having lots of homework. Simin is very nice. She is good at explaining things and even provides some examples. However, her iclicker questions and exams are tricky.
only expects you to learn from achieve. does not provide any other practice work to study from.
Some people rlly like her, others not so much. depends on your learning style i guess. she is reasonable and wants her students to do well. gives extra 1% for surveys and stuff.

Simin is such a caring prof and she really wants her students to succeed! Her lectures include the topics that most students find confusing and she is always looking for ways to help her students succeed whether that is having less quizzes or assigning extra practice homework. 
Highly recommend her class.
She's always willing to slow down the class if we are not understanding. She cares about her students and wants us to do well. I would highly recommend this professor!
Simin is a nice teacher. Tests are easy if you study too. Lots of marked homework though but other than that, Simin is pretty goated.

She genuinely seems to care for her students. She takes her time to thoroughly go through everything. I however personally didn't think her lectures were helpful for the exams. Achieve took way too much of my time,  especially the pre lectures that I didn't actually have time to practice on my own. Go to her office hours, she's very nice.

Great amazing professor. She is so kind and caring and provides great lectures. Lots of tricky iClicker questions, but as long as you participate and answer them, then you get full marks for them. Lots of difficult concepts but she does her best at helping students to understand. She uses Achieve.

She is very nice and teaches well but I found the lectures were quite hard to follow. It was also annoying to have to use Achieve as I was using up all my study time watching pre-lectures and doing assignments rather than actually learning the material. Exams were quite difficult too, I just wouldn't particularly recommend this course overall.

Professor Simin is nice and takes her time to explain concepts to you. The class I took was a "studio style" rather than lecture based. All we did were activities every class, I personally didn't find it helpful for the exams. The overall course concepts are very heavy so make sure to keep up and review every week.
She was the first prof i went to for office hours and she is so kind and helped us SOOO much. 10/10 experience would go again (going tomorrow)

I took Phys 102 in a lab setting and loved it. The professor was very accessible for questions and made sure you completely understood. The hands on learning made concepts easier to understand. Lots of homework given but the questions are very similar to test questions so although it was a lot it was very helpful. Generally just a nice person too!

I DIDNT FINISH in the other comment but she is actually really good. And always ready to help you even if you ask the stupidest qs everrr ( based on experience) DEFINETLY TAKE IT WITH HER plz YOU WILL LOVE HER AS MICH AS I DID . NOW I WISH YOU A GREAT PHYISCS SEM cuz there is no more physics for mebahababahaaaaha

GUYS dr.simin is the nicest phyiscs professor there is. Believe me when I say this because I HATE PHYISCS AND after physics 101 I was ready to die but taking phys 102 with her made physics a little less hard for me. Her exams are out of the homework and her recorded problem solving sessions SHE IS NOT TRICKING U. her mc are very conceptual tho

This is definitely the best way to take physics. She lectures for abt 30 mins of class then an activity for the other hour and a half which helped me learn way better. Lots of homework but it really helps with getting better with the material, she is very good at explaining concepts. Take with friends so they can be in your group for the activities

this class was fully online and it did not do her any favours. she tended to run out of time during the lecture and couldn't go over all of the material. i also thought that she wasn't clear and specific when answering questions. textbook lowkey sucks. make sure to practice and study lots if you're not good at physics (like me)!! [fall 2021]

There's lots of free marks for Iclicker, pre-lecture Q's, and (difficult) weekly Achieve assignments, but I found the volume of all these free marks left me very little time to actually read & understand the textbook. I also really hate courses that force us to use Achieve. I think it's a bad textbook. she's nice, but this learning style wasnt 4 me
Professor Najmi is a good professor. Physics can get really confusing but she is good at clarifying things when asked. She is also good at taking all questions.
Simin was great prof, she explained the topics thoroughly. Make sure to practice a lot well in the midterms and final.
Good lectures, she answers a lot of questions. She had some technical difficulties online but it was nothing significant. Does a good job explaining concepts.

Simin takes a hard course and makes it into an easy course. She has wonderful lectures from start to finish. She knows everything she is talking about and her lectures have the best iclicker's - very easy and show you how to apply most of the concepts as they come up. She will never make a trick question and even says I am not here to trick you

Lectures are online this year and on zoom, and every lecture we've had technical issues that take up a chunk of the 50 minutes to fix. Honestly feel like each lecture we have 30 mins of actual material learned and even then it feels rushed or hard to understand with her notes. Feel like I have to look at external sources to learn more than in class

Not much help available, i used to tutor physics 11 and everything covered in the course is explained much more complicated than needed. Subjects not fully covered in lecture and examples are way easier than actual assignments.
She is very kind and respected. Her lectures are easy and balanced.

Great Prof!! teaches like a highschool teacher... good notes and easy iclickers. I never liked physics and wasnt that great at it but got a B+. exams are straight forward and multiple choice is exactly like iclickers. i recommend her:)

great proff keps everything simple and concise she posts lectures online they are a bit more clear than the wones she does in class midterms andfinals super easy i got an A- in the class and i barely passed the midterms cause i didnt study wicked classs easy A

Her notes were great, and the final was pretty much the same as the review questions she did in class. Reading the textbook helped with iclicker questions.  Labs are completely pointless and easily finished in 30 min. Open labs were kind of helpful but they were only open 2 days a week

She was okay. She was really friendly and approachable, but her notes weren't very clear, skipped steps, and her notes posted online versus the ones she wrote out during lectures didn't correlate. Her accent made it a bit hard to understand when you sit near the back. But she means well, and I'm sure she's very nice.
amazing prof

Simin simplifies all the topics and makes them easy to understand. She encourages questions.  She is very open if you want to go and ask her anything.  Labs are completely pointless, usually finished within half an hour and are only worth a completion mark (you must complete all or you fail so no choice but to go)

When questions are asked sometimes she answers them but other times she explains something but doesn't actually answer your original question. Hardly ever gives actual definitions, she just explains everything by example. Examples given in class are easy but ones on test sometime have no connection to things learn in class.

She's a very fair teacher.  This was an intro to physics course anyways so the material is Grade 12 level, but the amount of work you must put in should be university level.  Her lecture notes are very simple, but the textbook explains the concepts introduced more.
Excellent Prof.  Just be sure to take notes during class. Trust me they are extremely helpful during exams.
